game.name: KODI
game.desc: Kodi (formerly known as XBMC) is an award-winning free and open source (GPL) software media center for playing videos, music, pictures, games, and more. Kodi runs on Linux, OS X, Windows, iOS, and Android, featuring a 10-foot user interface for use with televisions and remote controls. It allows users to play and view most videos, music, podcasts, and other digital media files from local and network storage media and the internet. Our forums and Wiki are bursting with knowledge and help for the new user right up to the application developer.

game.name: Freedoom - Phase I
game.desc: The freedoom project aims to create a complete free content game based on the Doom engine.

game.name: Freedoom - Phase II
game.desc: The freedoom project aims to create a complete free content game based on the Doom engine.

game.name: Wolfenstein 3D - Spear of Destiny Demo
game.desc: In Wolfenstein 3D, the player assumes the role of Allied spy William "B.J." Blazkowicz during WWII as he escapes from Nazi German prison Castle Wolfenstein and carrier out a series of crucial missions against the Nazis.

game.name: Wolfenstein 3D
game.desc: In Wolfenstein 3D, the player assumes the role of Allied spy William "B.J." Blazkowicz during WWII as he escapes from Nazi German prison Castle Wolfenstein and carrier out a series of crucial missions against the Nazis.

game.name: Commodore Basic
game.desc: Commodore BASIC, also known as PET BASIC or CBM-BASIC, is the dialect of the BASIC programming language used in Commodore International's 8-bit home computer line, stretching from the PET in 1977 to the C128 of 1985.

game.name: Minecraft Pi
game.desc: Minecraft is a popular sandbox open world buidling game. A free version of Minecraft is available for the Raspberry Pi; it also comes with a programming interface. This means you can write scripts in Python code to build things in the game automaticly. It's also a great way to learn Python!

game.name: Raspbian
game.desc: Raspbian is a Debian-based operating system for Raspberry Pi. Since 2015 it has been oficialy provided by the Raspberry Pi Foundation as the primary operating system for the Raspberry Pi family of compact single-board computers.
